intro: Planchonella torricellensis, commonly known as the Torricellense native lime, is a small evergreen tree native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and fragrant, yellowish flowers. The tree produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn yellow or orange when mature. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has limited use in traditional medicine and as a source of edible fruit.
